title: Riot never even gave a preliminary list of summoners on the Nautilus Plaque
body:
They just dumped it on the ocean floor and basically said "f#ck it, who cares if it's correct?"

It's pretty f*cking insulting that someone like me, who contributed twenty-something points during ocean week, who has been playing since Season 2, and who has been a fairly vocal member of the community BOTH a) isn't on the plaque AND b) wasn't even given a chance to troubleshoot the issue with Riot before the put it on the floor of the f#cking ocean. Generally when you do things that permanent, you have the forethought to make sure it's correct.

replies.body: They have had the list out for months now. Pay more attention next time.

Hey,

Did you earn those points during Ocean Week this year? If you earnt 10 or more this year you will get your name on the Ocean Week Community Wall (still in progress).

The Nautilus Reef is from Ocean Week 2015, which was a year ago, and you needed 3 or more points back then to get your name on it. We released the list of names for that back in the January update this year.

That was before Ocean Week 2016 was announced: http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/community/community-events/nautilus-reef-january-2016-update
I actually no-lifed the 2015 Ocean Week.

Hi A Blue Quaker,

You did earn enough points during Ocean Week 2015 (last year).

You actually had a different summoner name at the time which is on the reef on this list: http://promo.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/oceanweek-reef/index.html#find

The summoner name you had at the end of the challenge phase last year (when the reef was unlocked) is what appears on the reef.

If you can't remember what your summoner name was before you changed it, and you want me to, I can post it here for you.

I still agree with his main statement.
You guys should have released the names first, to double check.

Please do so with the wall.

I don't remember this?
I may have missed it.
They give updates about the reef and how it was progressing and a few months ago when they gave another update, they released the list which is the one people are viewing now.

> [{quoted}](name=Yasei Doubutsu,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=5ZNwQto3,comment-id=0002000200000000,timestamp=2016-04-11T10:58:02.561+0000)
>
> I don't remember this?
> I may have missed it.

http://promo.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/oceanweek/ 
This is what happened
i have been duoing with a friend  and he got his name on there i am 100% sure that i made the cut along side him

Hi My Wits End I just checked and you earned 1 point during Ocean Week 2015 (last year), which is not enough to get on the reef unfortunately.

You did however earn 60 points this year in Ocean Week 2016, so your name will go on the Ocean Week Community Wall - which is still in progress.
Is there any way i can check how many points i earned? i feel like i had enough but do not see my name on the list :(

Hey Tiggeris01,

You actually earned 2 points during Ocean Week 2015 (last year). Unfortunately that's not enough to get to the 3 points or more that you need to get your name on the reef.
thanks for the info .... still confused ... coz my duo partner got in and we only ever play together ,,,, but anyway thanks

I have earned over 50 points on both years but i have not yet found any of my previous name on the plaque seeing as i have changed a lot I'm not sure if thats got anything to do with it.   Previous names were, ImDuhN00b, The Cryopheonix or OneShotLord.
And i looked on the FAQ and I'm pretty sure i was The Cryopheonix at the time as it was last year I'm not 100% sure. 
95% sure i had over the points on lasts years and i remember doing it.
feeling pretty forgotten here too .... kinda shit the way they just  said f#@k it without double checking or something  {{item:3070}}
they released the list months ago and said "if your name should be here and isn't please contact Riot Support".
